storyInfo: Alanna thought her childhood home was lost to a Catastrophe, but an unexpected violation ticket brings her back home, accompanied by Warmy.

attributes.content: What's the score?
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick

attributes.content: You're ahead by ten. How about you just let me have this one?
attributes.name: Sweating Worker

attributes.content: I'll let ya have shit... watch this—strike from behind the back!
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick

attributes.content: Big Tooth—Big Tooth! My throat's smoldering!
Pour me a pint! A big one! Quick!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Lanns...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: And a bottle of carrot soda!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: A-Alanna?
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick
Alanna
attributes.content: You dropped your toothpick, Big Tooth—

attributes.name: Alanna
attributes.content: Eww, don't put it back in your mouth! That's disgusting!
I-It's really her!
attributes.name: Sweating Worker

attributes.content: What's with that look like you just saw a ghost?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's been a while. A whole year since you kicked that door in.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Really? That long? Give me that beer on the bar. I'm dying of thirst.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ah—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You said you came back for a violation ticket?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Yeah, got an electronic ticket from the Rim Billiton Big Pillar Autonomous Prefecture Residential Management Council while I was working overtime at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Residential Management Council? When did that happen... never mind. Keep going.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: The ticket said I had a 'non-compliant building' under my name, and it'd be torn down if I didn't pay the fine before the deadline!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Workers

attributes.content: I know, right? I thought my old home was long gone!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We're surprised alright, but the most surprising thing is...
attributes.name: Sweating Worker

attributes.content: You eat and sleep on your truck, can't walk straight on solid ground, and even made a bet that you can go without leaving your truck an entire year except to go to the bathroom...
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick

attributes.content: ...But you have a house? How?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: It was my mum and dad's. Well, I guess I inherited it, but I thought it'd collapsed ages ago. Even if it didn't, no way it's habitable after a Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But now you got a ticket...
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: So I came back in a hurry. What if the people who organized the evacuation were wrong? What if the Catastrophe didn't come at all?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: If it's that important, why'd you come here first?
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick

attributes.content: That might just be the smartest question to ever come out of your mouth, Big Tooth. Think about it. I gotta at least have a car if I'm gonna try to find the place after all these years, right?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ah, gotcha. But you don't just want a car, you want someone to drive it for you, don't ya?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Of course. I never drive tired. Sounds like you're interested?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna of the Barrenlands, the free spirit who drifts like the wind, has a secret den of her own? Of course I'm interested!
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet
Alanna
attributes.content: Deal! Righto, no time like the present. Let's get moving—

attributes.name: Alanna
attributes.content: Potlid!
Yes?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Grab a few bottles of carrot soda from Big Tooth over there. No need to pay—he owes me. And make sure they're cold!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Heh, take as many as ya like. All good, girlie. Good health to ya.
attributes.name: Worker Biting Toothpick

attributes.content: Th-Thank you...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: It's not on this map either?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Maybe the maps are too new... How could a big town like that just vanish from the map? It's only been a decade or so.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Well, we can't keep driving in circles. Anything else about the town that stands out, besides the Catastrophe?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Lemme think. There was a mine next to it, and the townsfolk all worked there.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: That describes like 99% of the towns in Rim Billiton.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Were your mum and dad miners too, Lanns?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Well, not exactly. They worked at the mines, though. Mum was an accountant, and pops was a welder. Why?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Nothing, just that you've never talked about them before.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Wait... I think I remember this intersection!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Try taking a right.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Yeah, this is it! Keep going!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Judging by the road signs, this road's been worked on recently.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Maybe someone's still living here!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna pokes her head out of the window, and forces her eyes open against the wind-borne dust.
A row of crooked rooftops appears on the horizon. Several pillars of smoke disperse in the air, covering the huts below in a smoky fog.
These crooked roofs, and this smell of cooking... that's the town I remember!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Maybe the Catastrophe Messengers were wrong.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: It must be! Maybe it took a turn along the way and went somewhere else!
attributes.name: Alanna
Alanna
attributes.content: Look, Potlid, my home—

attributes.name: Alanna
attributes.content: Whatcha doing, Potlid?
attributes.joined: You dropped your toothpick, Big Tooth—Eww, don't put it back in your mouth! That's disgusting!Deal! Righto, no time like the present. Let's get moving—Potlid!Look, Potlid, my home—  Whatcha doing, Potlid?

attributes.name: Warmy
attributes.content: Seventeen.

attributes.name: Warmy
attributes.content: Eighteen.

attributes.name: Warmy
attributes.content: Nineteen...
I'm counting the Originium pillars on the side of the road.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I see a lot more Originium clusters and cracks in the ground here than in other areas...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Didn't Alanna say there used to be a mine here? That would explain it.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Just stop in front of those houses, Charlie.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Sure. Gotta fill up the water tank anyway.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: This is the place, Potlid. There used to a lady here who made two-color cake on the edge of town... what was her name again?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: She had a garden she took good care of, where she grew flowers she bought from distant markets.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But this doesn't look like a garden.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Yeah, sure doesn't...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hey, don't step on my buds!
attributes.name: Barrenlands Settler

attributes.content: A-Aunt Susan?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Who ya callin' yer aunt?!
attributes.name: Barrenlands Settler

attributes.content: Just stop moving! You've already stomped on three of my beets!
attributes.name: Barrenlands Settler

attributes.content: I-I'm sorry! I thought you were someone else.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You know how hard it is to find an unpolluted piece of farmland in this hellhole? You'd better pay up, outsider!
attributes.name: Barrenlands Settler

attributes.content: Outsider...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: What's going on here?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The hose's connected, but it's gonna take a whole hour to fill... That's one huge water tank you've got there.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: Thanks. Here, have a pack of smokes.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Didn't expect there to be an auto repair shop in this town. Guess this place is pretty well-connected.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Connected my arse. Can't buy a toothpick out here. Everything's gotta be brought in by car, so of course we take good care of 'em.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: I only came here 'cause I was sick of being a mechanic. How was I supposed to know I'd be stuck back at my old job?
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: You moved here? So you're not from this town?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Can you really call this dump a 'town'? You couldn't find dirt if you dug six feet under. It's all broken bricks and rotten wood.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: No one would be here if the higher-ups weren't promising a big subsidy for some stupid 'environmental improvement' project.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: Look at all that Originium scrap under your feet. It's only been, what, ten, twenty years since the Catastrophe. It's barely livable.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: ...Did a Catastrophe really hit this place?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: None of the old houses are left?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Nothing but a bunch of scrap that couldn't be sold.
attributes.name: Barrenlands Mechanic

attributes.content: (On the way here, I thought I might find someone I knew, some kind of trace from my memory.)
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: (The Originium crystal clusters, the cracks in the ground, and even the broken tiles under my feet... they tell me all I need to know.)
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: (The Messengers were right. The Catastrophe came. My home... is gone.)
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Are you alright, Lanns?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, yeah, I'm good.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You've been staring at that hill.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Was your house on the other side?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Yeah... never mind. Just being silly.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna sighs and rubs her own face.
Then she shrugs and goes back to being her bright and sunny self.
What a shame. Here I thought I was gonna get a free house!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Wouldn't be much point though, without water or electricity. Might as well live in a truck.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's warm in the truck, but on Rhodes Island we have our own rooms.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: You will surely get a bigger, comfier house, Lanns... and then, can I move in with you?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Ha! Who else would cook for me?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You're not that bad of a cook yourself—
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: The tank's full, Alanna. You alright?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: I asked around. They all say...
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Yeah, I know. Thanks anyway.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'll ask a few more. Maybe somebody knows where your house was... You might find some kinda closure, even if it's just a single brick.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: How would they know anything when they're all new here?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Let's just head on back to Rustdreg. There's still time to grab a few drinks with some more of my old friends.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna turns around, avoiding looking at the bare slope and everything behind it.
No one knows where her home is better than herself.
She had climbed that slope many times, and slid all the way back home over the smooth grass.
She would grin while her mother looked at all the mud on her with chagrin.
I'll go warm up the engine. No rush. I'll be waiting inside.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Let's go, Potlid. It'll be dark soon.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Anything you wanna eat once we get back to Rustdreg? How about some old fashioned cream pasta?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna takes a few steps, but then realizes Potlid is not following her.
Potlid?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Look Lanns, I've got a scar on my knee.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Didn't you get that when you left the dorms? Does it still hurt?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Not anymore. It hurt a lot at first, but I didn't want to cry because there were a lot of people in the corridor. At that time, you said—
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: 'It's tiring trying to hold back tears. You're already hurting—don't tire yourself out too.'
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Then I cried, and after that it didn't hurt so much anymore.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Warmy approaches Alanna and takes her hand.
Your fingers have been trembling...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Now Warmy's holding your hand. There's no need to hold back.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Potlid...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's okay to feel scared or sad. I cried a lot when I first left home.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I started crying less after you started taking care of me.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But I won't be a little kid forever. I've grown up, and I can take care of you too.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I don't want you to be too hard on yourself. I know it's really tough, really tiring...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But it's not fair for me to weigh you down with all my emotional baggage... Potlid, you don't need to share my burden.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Isn't that what family's for? We share our burdens together, eat our meals together, and rub medicine on our wounds together.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: We've come such a long way together, Lanns. Aren't we family by now?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alanna holds the small and warm hand in her own.
...Yeah, we are.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: If you want to take another look, let's go. I'll be with you.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Lanns.
Mm?
The slope's so gentle, and the sand is so soft.
Mm-hm...
You've walked this path home so many times, haven't you?
Will you tell me? What this place used to look like...
I remember...
...I remember this place used to be covered in grass, and you'd slip after it rained if you weren't careful.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: There's still grass. But it's tiny, like it's just poking out of the soil.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Have you ever slid down a patch of grass?
attributes.name: Alanna
Warmy
attributes.content: No. That sounds dangerous...

attributes.name: Warmy
attributes.content: But fun too!
When I was your age, I used to come here and slide down from the top of the slope.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Were you always so brave?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: More bored than brave.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I didn't make any new friends for a long time after moving here with my parents. But I didn't want to stay home all the time either, because it was always noisy at home...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Aren't homes supposed to be noisy? It sounds lively.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Um... not that kind of noisy. My mum and dad worked in the mines, where you'd have to shout to get heard over all the mine noises.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But they'd still do that at home, like they were yelling at each other. Always with a smile on their face, though. Even when they weren't yelling, they were always playing music at max volume.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: And even when they did argue, they'd keep right on smiling, so I wouldn't notice. But I did. Because who cries when they're smiling?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So whenever they'd argue, I'd come here, slide down the grass, then climb back up and do it again.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You were hurting inside, weren't you?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Yeah, and in the end I always had to go back home with mud all over my clothes. I made sure to put on a smile before I went in, so my mum wouldn't worry about me.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Later, they had an argument over that, too. After that one, pops made a bunch of stuff in the yard. A swing, a trampoline, even a little pavilion.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: My dad said he'd make me a swing and put it on the porch.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Why do grown-ups always think kids will like that kind of stuff?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I did. I love swings, trampolines, and pavilions... but my dad never got around to making it.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Then I'll make 'em for you when we get back to Rhodes Island, fill up your room with them. How's that?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hehe...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: We're almost at the top. Soon we'll see the other side...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Why do you stop, Lanns?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: If you're too scared to look, close your eyes, and I'll look for you...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: How about that?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Broken bricks, tiles, and charred wood creak as they walk across them.
In the gaps, tiny pieces of broken glass and Originium crystals reflect the last rays of sunset.
Is it just me, or have we been spending a long time walking these last few steps?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We're almost there. Watch your step... take it easy.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: There's a lot of broken glass here. It's all twinkly. Like stars!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: It's all over the path! It's like...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Like what?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Like the stars are welcoming you home!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Home...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: If there's nothing there, don't tell me, just take me back to the truck.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ...Alright?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Potlid lets go and runs up.
Potlid?!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Where are you? Are we on top of the hill?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: She frantically reaches out, eyes still closed, and eventually finds Warmy's hand. Warmy is sobbing.
Sobbing, then laughing. She shakes Alanna by the shoulders and shouts—
Look!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Lanns—
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alanna opens her eyes slowly.
At the foot of the hill, a short distance away, she sees an overgrown ruin, the roof, windows, and doors all broken and battered.
Countless days and nights have passed. The wind, sun, and rain have caused even the strongest beams to rot and break.
But a single swing stands before the ruins.
Ugly, rusted, yet tough, it swings gently in the night breeze.
Creak—
'No! Look how high she's swinging, standing on the swing! She's going above the clothesline poles!'
'It's dangerous... bring me those canvas pants of yours you never wear. I'll make her a safety belt.'
'Don't cry, honey, don't cry, let mummy see where you got hurt... Oh no! You scratched your knee!'
'I told you it wasn't safe! Look at the frame! It just snapped!'
'This is all my fault... Sorry, Alanna. It's daddy's fault.'
'Where are you going at this hour?'
'Sleep now, honey. The sun's not up; it's just your daddy's soldering iron.'
'God knows what he's doing... Don't worry, I'll tell him you're not mad at him. You're such a good girl, Alanna.'
'Look, Alanna! Daddy made the swing stronger for you. Look at these steel pipes. See how thick they—What? You think it's ugly?'
'But it's so solid. I promise you, you won't fall no matter how high you swing—No, I take that back. Don't swing too high!'
'Daddy's fine. Gotta go to work. Let's play with the new swing once your mum and I get back tonight, alright?'
'Don't play it on your own, okay? Wait for mummy to come back and put the safety belt on you.'
'See you later, Alanna!'
But...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: They said there was an accident in the mine. I didn't even know what that meant at the time.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: All I remember is the carrot juice in the cup on the table, sloshing back and forth.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: A lot of people came by later. They wanted to take me away from home. They pointed at the strange clouds in the sky, said that the accident caused an Originium dust leak. A Catastrophe was coming, and I had to leave.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: They bashed open the door and took me away.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I... never had the chance to say goodbye to my home.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Some things don't feel so heavy once you've said them out loud.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But if you leave them in your heart, they become huge rocks. You always hated dragging rocks around when you were using the passenger compartment to haul cargo, didn't you?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Yeah, it's slow and you have to worry the whole way.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna picks up a rock and throws it into the distance.
But now that I've thrown my rocks away, I can run free again!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You took me up this hill, Potlid. Now it's my turn to take you forward.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh? Lanns—
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alanna grins and pulls Warmy along towards the ruin at the foot of the hill.
She has walked this path home countless times. Now she recreates it, long after Catastrophe wiped it away.
S-Slow down, Lanns!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Welcome to my place! Listen, they're all welcoming you—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Creak—
The night breeze blows through the cracks of the steel bars and chains. The sound of grinding metal echoes in the wind.
Wanna try it out? Don't worry, it's really solid.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: C-Can I really?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: You always wanted a swing, didn't you? Here's one.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'll make a better one for you once we get back to Rhodes Island!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But your dad made it for you...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: I already played with it when I was little. It's your turn now. Every kid loves a swing!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'm not a kid anymore!
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: That's right. You're all grown up, a big girl who's ready to share my burdens.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Once you're even taller than me, it'll be your turn to push me on the swing. But for now... let your Lanns take care of you a little longer.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna lifts Warmy up onto the swing and grabs the safety belt.
The cloth on the surface is completely faded, but the metal chains within remain strong.
Warmy looks up and takes in Alanna's every little action as she fastens the safety belt.
My mum spent a lot of time sewing this belt. She never let pops touch it—said she didn't feel comfortable if she didn't do it herself.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: She must have wanted to spend more time with you.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: How does this thing work again? I think this was how she did it...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alright! Totally secured. You won't fall no matter how high you swing.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The frame's really stable too. A little rusty, but it doesn't shake no matter how hard you swing.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I remember pops spent the whole night on it. The soldering iron cast a bright light on the window. Now that I look at the marks, I recognize them...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's the most labor-intensive way of soldering, but also the strongest.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: There are a lot of things you don't realize until you grow up... That's what you always say to me when there's something you can't explain clearly.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alanna begins pushing the swing gently. It carries Warmy along with a creaking that echoes through the quiet night.
Echoing into the distance.
Lanns... I think it's starting to rain.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: But the stars are still so bright...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Shall we go?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Yeah, let's go. We'll talk later.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Say, Lanns, didn't you have a ticket?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Oh yeah! I almost forgot! What was up with that? Let me see...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I've been meaning to ask since you first brought it up, because I've never heard of no 'Residential Management Council'.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: 'The aforementioned building will be demolished if you do not pay the fine before the deadline.'
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It doesn't say where you pay it though. What's on the back?
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: 'Your personal bank account will also be frozen. In order to avoid any interruption with your funds...'
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: 'Please transfer all funds in your account to our designated safe account. The account is managed by the Rim Billiton General Bank and your money will be absolutely safe.'
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's a bloody scam!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Should've read the whole thing first. Guess my brain just turned off when I read it was gonna get torn down.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But we wouldn't be here if not for this scam letter.
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Fate works in funny ways, huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The mechanic I talked to said that more people will move in once the environmental improvement project is complete. They'll build a new community here.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: The place where your home used to be will get turned into a playground with seesaws and slides. A place for kids with too much energy and nowhere to spent it.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Doesn't sound so bad. What do you think, Potlid?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: (Yawns) Mm...
attributes.name: Warmy

attributes.content: Alanna takes her gaze off the night outside the window and gazes upon Warmy's face as the young girl dozes off in her arms.
There is a tiny tear upon Warmy's eyelashes.
Alanna closes her own eyes too, and sees in her head that tiny trail full of starlight, and the swing waiting at its end.
'Goodbye,' she says in her mind.
Goodbye.
